name: St. Lorenzo Ruiz

locations.description: First Filipino saint, martyred in Japan
Martyred in Nagasaki during the Tokugawa persecution

summary: Lorenzo Ruiz was a Filipino layman who became the first Filipino saint. He was a family man who worked as a clerk in Manila. When falsely accused of a crime, he fled to Japan with Dominican missionaries. In Japan, he was arrested during the Tokugawa persecution and was tortured for refusing to renounce his faith. He was martyred by being hung upside down in a pit. He was canonized in 1987 and is the patron saint of the Philippines, Filipino people, and Filipino youth.
